concept.title: UID Manipulation Overview
concept.shortdesc: Describes how globally unique identifiers are manipulated.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: To guarantee uniqueness, all UID values are assigned to developers centrally by Symbian.

section.title: Architectural relationships
section.p: Symbian platform makes extensive use of UIDs to provide lightweight identification of file types. This includes both document and executable files. APIs that need to manipulate files therefore typically use UIDs.

section.title: Description
section.p: The API has two key concepts: UID and compound identifier.
The UID is a small wrapper class around a 32-bit value that provides comparison operators and conversion to text.
The UID interface is provided by TUid.
The compound identifier is a group of up to three UIDs that identify the type of a file. The meaning of the UIDs varies according to whether the file is a DLL, or document file, etc.
The compound identifier interface is provided by TUidType.
